message.content:
cs.HC, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.DS

Reasoning: 
- cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) is the most likely category as the paper deals with crowdsourcing platforms and the evaluation of the quality of responses obtained from the crowd, which are related to human-computer interaction.
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also likely as the paper proposes an innovative measure of expertise using the theory of belief functions, which is a common technique in AI.
- cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is relevant as the paper deals with the evaluation of the quality of responses obtained from the crowd, which is related to information retrieval.
- cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is relevant as crowdsourcing platforms involve a large crowd of users, which can be seen as a social network.
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is less likely but still possible as the paper proposes a method to measure expertise based on the definition of four factors, which can be seen as a data structure.
